datafield.subfield: Science and pseudoscience in clinical psychology /
edited by Scott O. Lilienfeld, Steven Jay Lynn, Jeffrey M. Lohr ; foreword by Carol Tavris.

Science and pseudoscience in clinical psychology: initial thoughts, reflections, and considerations / Scott O. Lilienfeld, Steven Jay Lynn, and Jeffrey M. Lohr -- pt. 1. Controversies in assessment and diagnosis. Understanding why some clinicians use pseudoscientific methods: findings from research on clinical judgment / Howard N. Garb and Patricia A. Boyle -- Controversial and questionable assessment techniques / John Hunsley, Catherine M. Lee, James M. Wood and Whitney Taylor -- The science and pseudoscience of expert testimony / Joseph T. McCann, Steven Jay Lynn, Scott O. Lilienfeld, Kelley L. Shindler, and Tammy R. Hammond -- Dissociative identity disorder: a contemporary scientific perspective / Scott O. Lilienfeld and Steven Jay Lynn -- pt. 2. Overarching controversies in psychological treatment. The science of psychotherapy: developing, testing, and promoting evidence-based treatments / Brandon A. Gaudiano, Kristy L. Dalrymple, Lauren M. Weinstock, and Jeffrey M. Lohr -- New age and related novel unsupported therapies in mental health practice / Monica Pignotti and Bruce a. Thyer -- Constructing the past: problematic memory recovery techniques in psychotherapy / Steven Jay Lynn, Elisa Krackow, Elizabeth F. Loftus, Timothy G. Locke, and Scott O. Lilienfeld -- Self-help therapy: recent developments in the science and business of giving psychology away / Gerald M. Rosen, Russell E. Glasgow, Timothy E. Moore, and Manuel Barrera Jr. -- pt. 3. Controversies in the treatment of adult disorders. Science- and non-science-based treatments for trauma-related stress disorders / Jeffrey M. Lohr, Richard Gist, Brett Deacon, Grant J. Devilly, and Tracey Varker -- Controversial treatments for alchol use disorders / James MacKillop and Joshua C. Gray -- Herbal treatments and antidepressant medication: similar data, divergent conclusions / Harald Walach and Irving Kirsch -- pt. 4. Controversies in the treatment of child and adolescent disorders. Empirically supported, promising, and unsupported treatments for Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder / Daniel A. Waschbusch and James G. Waxmonsky -- The status of treatment for Autism Spectrum Disorders: the weak realtionship of science to interventions / Raymond G. Romanczyk, Laura B. Turner, Melina Sevlever, and Jennifer M. Gillis -- Attachment therapy / Jean Mercer -- Antisocial behavior of children and adolescents: harmful treatments, effective interventions, and novel strategies / Anthony Petrosino, Pamela MacDougall, Meghan E. Hollis-Peel, Trevor A. Fronius, and Sarah Guckenberg -- Science and pseudoscience in clinical psychology: concluding thoughts and constructive remedies / Scott O. Lilienfeld, Steven Jay Lynn, and Jeffrey M. Lohr.
